intro: Swertia endotricha, commonly known as the Himalayan swertia, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered with a fine layer of hair. The flowers, which are usually blue or violet, bloom in late summer and attract various pollinators.
